prs.title: 🚀 Version packages
prs.truncated_body:
This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.


# Releases
## @layerzerolabs/devtools-solana@3.0.0

### Minor Chan

prs.title: Aptos framework rev patch
prs.truncated_body:
`aptos-framework`'s latest commit from the `mainnet` branch can introduce breaking changes, as such the branch `mainnet@latest` only supports `aptos-cli v7` and breaks on older `aptos-cli` versions. We use `aptos-cli v6` (6.0.1) 

Using `aptos-framework`'s branch mainnnet @ latest` breaks our CLI and local builds:
https://github.com/LayerZero-Labs/devtools/actions/runs/16329839557/job/462147532

commits.message: adding link to comment for vis

prs.title: [INT-499] Patch Update Move.toml with commit hash before breaking change and RE…
prs.truncated_body: …ADME.md files across multiple examples to ensure compatibility with Aptos CLI version <= 3.5.0.

prs.title: kurtosis: Add rollup.interopmempoolfiltering to ELs
prs.truncated_body:
Our Acceptance Tests send transactions directly to the Sequencer for block building. While this is good for simple network testing, it does not match a production topology, where proxyd and other mempools would buffer the sequencer.

However, we *did* follow the guidance of interop topology, and never enabled Ingress Filtering for the sequencer. This meant that most transactions got filtered out

prs.title: fix(fortuna): Fix nonce increment issues on high usage chains
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

We are seeing high latency on blast responses. After investigating, @tejasbadadare and I determined that the root cause is that we are incorrectly incrementing the local nonce on occasions where we do not send the transaction to the RPC. This specifically happens when a transaction reverts -- we are incrementing the nonce before identifying that the tx reverts.

This PR adds an est

commits.message: fix(fortuna): Fix nonce increment issues on high usage chains

prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

This PR implements the queryPriceFeed and priceFeedExists functions. It also cleans up a lot of the testing logic, which was pretty messy to this point,

- [x] Added new tests

commits.message:
feat: modify PriceFeedReturn to use byte arrays and simplify parsing logic

- Change PriceFeedReturn from hex string to byte array ([u8; 32], U64, I32, I64, U64, I64, U64)
- Update parse_price_feed_updates_internal to return Vec<PriceFeedReturn> instead of Vec<([u8; 32], PriceFeedReturn)>
- Simplify parse_price_feed_updates_with_config by removing price_map and using direct indexing with find()
- Simplify update_price_feeds_internal to avoid dual variable iteration and directly index structs
- Update test data functions to use byte arrays from helper functions instead of hex strings
- Add helper functions for different feed IDs used in multiple updates tests

All tests pass successfully with these changes.

Co-Authored-By: ayush.suresh@dourolabs.xyz <byteSlayer31037@gmail.com>

feat: add price_id field to PriceFeedStorage and rename from PriceInfoStorage

- Add price_id field as StorageFixedBytes<32> to PriceInfoStorage struct
- Rename PriceInfoStorage to PriceFeedStorage for consistency
- Update import statement and storage map declaration in lib.rs
- Update update_price_feeds_internal to populate price_id field when storing price data
- All tests pass with structural changes

Co-Authored-By: ayush.suresh@dourolabs.xyz <byteSlayer31037@gmail.com>
finished adding id back to return type, distinguishing between get return type and the overall price feed return that will be given from the query function
trying to clean up testing framework

prs.title: Fix pretty printing for Catch2.
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Fix pretty printing for Catch2.

Since Catch2::StringMaker specializations have been defined in a separate header, the wrong include order of that header would lead to ODR violation, that caused some (most?) tests to fallback to the default StringMaker defined in catch.hpp.

The fix just makes it so all the tests just include Catch2 via the header that also defines the StringM

commits.message:
Fix pretty printing for Catch2.

Since Catch2::StringMaker specializations have been defined in a separate header, the wrong include order of that header would lead to ODR violation, that caused some (most?) tests to fallback to the default StringMaker defined in catch.hpp.

The fix just makes it so all the tests just include Catch2 via the header that also defines the StringMakers. I believe this should prevent ODR violations, as long as we use the new header for including Catch2 consistently.

prs.title: Apply phase fixes
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Fixes two bugs in the `LedgerManager::ApplyPhase` invariants.

1. Invalid setup -> setup state transition when calling `applyBucketsForLCL`. The fix for this is calling `markApplyStateReset` before entering `ApplyBucketsWork`, since when calling `ApplyBucketsWork` via `applyBucketsForLCL`, we're already in setup mode.
2. Race condition with background apply. We now mark the end

commits.message: Fix issue with ApplyBucket setup phase invariant
Fix apply phase invariant race condition
Add test cases for ApplyState phase edge cases

We've determined that this change causes too many old messages to be sent to signers, slowing block production and causing some to be forever stuck behind. In addition to reverting that change, the other location that was already

commits.message: fix: do not send events to observers for stale stackerdb messages

prs.title: Do not count accept and reject from same signer
prs.truncated_body: If a signer sends a duplicate block acceptance or rejection, ignore the repeats. If a signer has previously rejected a block, delete the rejection if it later accepts it. If a signer has previously accepted a block, ignore a rejection and warn about it (this shouldn't happen).

commits.message:
feat: do not count both accept and reject

If a signer sends a duplicate block acceptance or rejection, ignore the
repeats. If a signer has previously rejected a block, delete the
rejection if it later accepts it. If a signer has previously accepted a
block, ignore a rejection and warn about it (this shouldn't happen).
refactor: move rejection deletion before acceptance insertion

fix: update `block_rejection_signer_addrs` table's primary key

Previously, this table was keyed on the `signer_addr` only, but now we
want to key on the signer address and the sighash of the block.

feat: various sql improvements from code review

Thanks @Jiloc!
test: fix ordering in tests after change to primary key
chore: integrate db changes into v16

prs.truncated_body: This just helps make the miner logs more readable.

commits.message:
chore: only log new block proposal responses, not duplicates

This just helps make the miner logs more readable.

prs.title: Make super noisy logs in capitulate_miner_view into debug level logs
prs.truncated_body: In theory in both of these debug log instances, we could attempt to query the node for the missing blocks, but I am worried that we enter into these scenarios often when we are already fallign behind and further stressing the node seems a bad idea...

commits.message:
Make super noisy logs in capitulate_miner_view into debug level logs

If there is an error from any bug, this loop will retry continuously, causing busy waiting and verbose log. This adds a timeout on error.

## How this works

Adds timeout on error.

prs.title: Throttle platformVM block building until normal ops
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

When the platformVM is bootstrapping, WaitForEvent() is called on it by the notification forwarder, which forwards the events to the handler, which in turn routes them to the appropriate engine according to the state.

The platformVM cannot know when it should propose a block until it has finished bootstrapping, and as a result it will fail in attempting.

If th

commits.message:
Throttle platformVM block building until normal ops

When the platformVM is bootstrapping, WaitForEvent() is called on it by the notification forwarder,
which forwards the events to the handler, which in turn routes them to the appropriate engine according to the state.

The platformVM cannot know when it should propose a block until it has finished bootstrapping, and as a result it will fail in attempting.

If the proposerVM selects the platformVM for block building before it has finished bootstrapping, it will result in the notifier in a spinning loop
until it has finished bootstrapping.

This fix makes the platformVM throttle its WaitForEvent() call until it has finished bootstrapping.

Signed-off-by: Yacov Manevich <yacov.manevich@avalabs.org>

prs.title: [tmpnet] Source tmpnet defaults from a configmap
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Previously the scheduling label and value required to enable exclusive scheduling were defined as flag defaults. To enable the cluster to define these defaults, the defaults are now sourced from a configmap in the target namespace.

## How this was tested

CI, manually

## Need to be documented in RELEASES.md?

N/A

commits.message:
[tmpnet] Source tmpnet defaults from a configmap

Previously the scheduling label and value required to enable exclusive
scheduling were defined as flag defaults. To enable the cluster to
define these defaults, the defaults are now sourced from a configmap
in the target namespace.

prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
This PR adds the functionality to periodically reset the connection stream by sending `EndStream.RESET` request to the current active connection (block node) and connect to the next block node priority wise. 

- The period to occasionally reset the stream is defined by a new configuration property `streamResetPeriod`.
- Introduced a new method `BlockNodeConnection#endTheStream

prs.title: fix!: bridge does not crash when contract manager loop exits
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

This PR fixes a bug in the graceful shutdown mechanism where the bridge node was not crashing when the contract manager event loop exited unexpectedly.

The issue was that the contract manager task always returned `Ok(())` even when the event loop exited due to errors, preventing the `TaskManager` from detecting the failure and crashing the node as expected.

### Type of Chan

commits.message: fix!(duty-tracker): ContractManager's thread handle returns a result
fix(alpen-bridge): properly handle both shutdown and error cases

prs.title: STR-1502: Abort Contracts
prs.truncated_body:
Implements non-crashing abort behavior if deposit transaction isn't issued before the abort deadline.

## Description

This is a super simple change just to make sure we don't crash if we ever abort a contract. Right now we do nothing and we keep these contracts around indefinitely. This technically constitutes a resource leak but it will not be an issue to begin with. The change needed to get

commits.message: duty-tracker: add aborted state to CSM, explicitly do nothing on OperatorDuty::Abort
refactor(csm): use unit struct instead of empty struct for `Aborted` state
feat(csm): produce fulfillment duty even in `Aborted` state to advance stake chain
